item.title: What We Know About the Gun Battle With Cuban Border Troops
item.description: Four armed Cuban nationals aboard a Florida-based speedboat died in a gunfight with border troops near the island nation’s coast, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei, Frances Robles, Jack Nicas, Eric Schmitt and Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:description: Cuban Coast Guard ships docked at the port of Havana on Wednesday.

item.title: Qué significa: ‘benevolent’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 126 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: El futsal en Afganistán: un héroe inesperado para los talibanes
item.description: Una victoria en el fútbol sala ha convertido a Alireza Ahmadi, de 17 años, y a otros jugadores de la minoría hazara, marginada durante mucho tiempo en Afganistán, en héroes nacionales.
item.dc:creator: Elian Peltier, Yaqoob Akbary and Tomás Munita

media:content.media:credit: Tomas Munita for The New York Times

item.title: Word of the Day: benevolent
item.description: This word has appeared in 126 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Lo que el escenario de ‘Cumbres borrascosas’ nos dice sobre el Reino Unido actual
item.description: Yorkshire del Oeste, donde se escribió la historia original de ‘Cumbres borrascosas’, ofrece una ventana a las fuerzas que están perturbando la política británica.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear and Andrew Testa

item.title: Un nuevo estudio habría descubierto la razón de la buena memoria de los ‘superancianos’
item.description: El artículo publicado el miércoles aborda si los cerebros humanos pueden generar nuevas neuronas en la edad adulta.
item.dc:creator: Dana G. Smith

item.title: Japan Is Redefining Its Place in the World
item.description: Sanae Takaichi’s political rise presages a stronger Japan that could reshape the strategic balance in Asia and help deter Chinese aggression.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Walker

item.title: North Korea’s ​Kim Jong-un Hints at Improving U.S. Relations — With Caveats
item.description: ​ The North Korean leader said that his country can get along well with the United States as long as Washington accepts it as a nuclear weapons state.
item.dc:creator: Choe Sang-Hun

media:content.media:description: A news broadcast in Seoul on Thursday showing footage of Kim Jong-un, North Korea’s leader, speaking at the ruling Workers’ Party congress.

item.title: En los archivos Epstein faltan documentos sobre una mujer que acusó a Trump
item.description: Los documentos publicados por el Departamento de Justicia mencionan brevemente una acusación no verificada de que Donald Trump la agredió en la década de 1980, cuando era menor de edad. Pero varios memorandos relacionados con su testimonio no figuran en los archivos.
item.dc:creator: Mike Baker and Michael Gold
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Cuando el Departamento de Justicia hizo públicos los archivos a finales del mes pasado, funcionarios dijeron que incluían todo el material enviado por el público al FBI.

item.title: Así es Tapalpa, el pueblito donde el Mencho se refugió por última vez
item.description: Los reporteros del Times que visitaron Tapalpa encontraron un pueblo sereno conmocionado tras la redada del domingo en sus afueras, que dejó decenas de muertos y gente que huía. Y, sorprendentemente, no hay presencia policial o militar donde tuvo lugar la batalla.
item.dc:creator: Paulina Villegas and César Rodríguez

media:content.media:credit: César Rodríguez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The town of Tapalpa, in Jalisco state, Mexico, is a stronghold of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

item.title: President Emmanuel Macron’s Cultural Legacy At Risk After Louvre Chief Resigns
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron has championed a refurbishment of the museum, but the fallout from a sensational heist has put his plans at risk.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler

media:content.media:description: President Emmanuel Macron giving a speech last year at the Louvre, in front of the Mona Lisa.

item.title: For Trump, Military Strike in Iran Could Serve Symbolic Purpose
item.description: Some officials in the Trump administration hope an attack would force Iran to give up its nuclear enrichment program. Others have doubts.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes and Helene Cooper

media:content.media:description: American fighter jets on the aircraft carrier Gerald R. Ford off the coast of Greece. The U.S. military is amassing firepower in the region near Iran.

item.title: The Gorton and Denton By-Election Comes at a Bad Time for Keir Starmer
item.description: A parliamentary by-election in Gorton and Denton, outside Manchester, will test support for Britain’s prime minister at a moment of intense political pressure.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear and Stephen Castle

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain at a Labour campaign event on Monday ahead of the Gorton and Denton by-election in Manchester, England.

item.title: One Nation, an Anti-Immigration Party in Australia, Rises in Polls After Bondi Massacre
item.description: The foreign roots of the men accused of killing 15 at a Jewish event have helped make Pauline Hanson and her One Nation party more palatable for some Australians.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim

media:content.media:credit: Darren England/Australian Associated Press, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: Pauline Hanson, the leader of the One Nation party, at a rally in Brisbane, Australia, last month. She has long argued that Australia needs to curb what she calls “mass migration.”

item.title: A.I. Dating Apps Complicate China’s Efforts to Boost Birthrate
item.description: As China grapples with a shrinking population and historically low birthrate, people are finding romance with chatbots instead.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Stevenson, Murphy Zhao and Meaghan Tobin

item.title: A Deal or War? Crucial Talks to Begin Between U.S. and Iran
item.description: President Trump has kept up a steady drumbeat of threats and built up U.S. troops in the region. Iran’s task is to give him a win but also preserve some semblance of nuclear enrichment.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A large billboard depicting missiles in Tehran in 2024. While nuclear enrichment is being discussed this week, Iran’s missile program is not currently on the table.

item.title: Quote of the Day: In Windsor, Andrew’s Fall Is Met With Sadness, or Apathy
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, February 26, 2026.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Feb. 26, 2026
item.description: Yitzi Snow makes his New York Times Crossword debut.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: Trump Administration Withholds $259 Million in Medicaid Funds From Minnesota
item.description: Vice President JD Vance said that the Trump administration had been forced to “turn the screws on” Minnesota so the state would respond to allegations of fraud.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: Vice President JD Vance at the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Kalshi Accuses a ‘MrBeast’ Employee of Insider Trading
item.description: The prediction-market platform said it had reported the employee to federal regulators. The show’s parent company said it had “no tolerance for this behavior.”
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor

item.title: Patel Fires F.B.I. Personnel Tied to Inquiry Into Trump and Classified Records
item.description: The firings are part of a rolling barrage of retribution aimed at those who worked on the two federal prosecutions of President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush, Alan Feuer and Devlin Barrett
item.category: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)

media:content.media:credit: Pete Kiehart for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The F.B.I. building in Washington, D.C. The firings came hours after Kash Patel, the F.B.I. director, said that as part of the documents inquiry, the bureau had subpoenaed phone metadata for himself and Susie Wiles, currently the White House chief of staff.

item.title: No Corrections: Feb. 26, 2026
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Thursday, Feb. 26, 2026.

item.title: Lawmakers Ask Tech Companies What User Data They Provided to D.H.S.
item.description: The requests followed Times reporting that the Department of Homeland Security had sent Meta and other companies subpoenas for information on accounts that track or comment on ICE.
item.dc:creator: Sheera Frenkel

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Bennie Thompson of Mississippi is one of three Democratic lawmakers asking tech companies about requests for user data from the Department of Homeland Security.

item.title: Hunter College Places Professor Who Made ‘Abhorrent’ Remarks on Leave
item.description: The professor, speaking on a hot mic, said, “They’re too dumb to know they’re in a bad school” when a student objected to the possible closure of a middle school. The remark was assailed as racist.
item.dc:creator: Troy Closson

media:content.media:description: Hunter College said a professor who made inflammatory remarks will remain on leave until an investigation is completed into whether her conduct violated school policies.

item.title: Police Officer Accused of Tracking Partner Using License Plate Reader
item.description: The Milwaukee officer used the technology to run searches on his partner’s plate 124 times, officials said, and he also tracked the person’s ex.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Ziegler

media:content.media:description: If convicted on the misdemeanor charge, attempted misconduct in public office, the officer could face up to nine months in prison and a $10,000 fine.

item.title: Las fuerzas de Cuba ya han enfrentado otras embarcaciones de EE. UU.
item.description: El miércoles, una lancha rápida matriculada en Florida entró en aguas cubanas y algunos de sus tripulantes intercambiaron disparos con tropas de Cuba. En 2022 ocurrieron dos enfrentamientos de este tipo.
item.dc:creator: Frances Robles

media:content.media:description: En 2022, el Ministerio del Interior de Cuba anunció que ese año había interceptado un total de 13 lanchas rápidas dedicadas al tráfico ilícito de personas. También interceptaron otras embarcaciones, como la de arriba, el 12 de diciembre de ese año.

item.title: Trump’s State of the Union Was a Win for Democrats
item.description: Ezra Klein and Aaron Retica react to Trump’s 2026 State of the Union speech.
item.dc:creator: Ezra Klein, Aaron Retica, Claire Gordon and Marie Cascione

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times

item.title: An Inside Look at the State of the Union
item.description: Our photojournalist Kenny Holston was the only news photographer on the House floor during President Trump’s State of the Union speech. Here’s how he captured his images.
item.dc:creator: Kenny Holston, Sutton Raphael, Mac Schneider and Nikolay Nikolov

item.title: Ilhan Omar Condemns Guest’s Arrest at Trump’s State of the Union
item.description: Aliya Rahman, a U.S. citizen who was dragged from her vehicle after an ICE agent shattered its window, was charged with unlawful conduct after standing up during President Trump’s speech.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Michael Gold

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Ilhan Omar, Democrat of Minnesota, at the State of the Union address yesterday.

item.title: How Social Media Framed Trump’s State of the Union Speech
item.description: Here’s how social media may have shaped your impressions of the State of the Union.
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck

media:content.media:description: President Trump giving his State of the Union address.

item.title: España desclasifica los archivos del golpe de Estado fallido del 23-F
item.description: Tras más de cuatro décadas de conjeturas, el gobierno español publicó documentos de una investigación mantenida en secreto durante mucho tiempo sobre un golpe fallido de 1981.
item.dc:creator: Jason Horowitz
item.category: Juan Carlos I, King of Spain
Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

media:content.media:description: El teniente coronel Antonio Tejero Molina, con una pistola en la mano, intentando dar un golpe de Estado en el Parlamento español el 23 de febrero de 1981.

item.title: Vessels Have Clashed With Cuban Border Forces Before
item.description: On Wednesday, a Florida-registered speedboat entered Cuban waters and some on board exchanged gunfire with Cuban troops. Two such armed clashes occurred in 2022.
item.dc:creator: Frances Robles

media:content.media:description: In 2022, Cuba’s Ministry of Interior announced that it had intercepted a total of 13 speedboats engaged in migrant-smuggling that year. They also intercepted other vessels, like the one above on Dec. 12 of that year.

item.title: Trump’s Push for Election Power Raises Fears He Will ‘Subvert’ Midterms
item.description: The president appears to be undermining Americans’ faith in the outcome, at a moment when Republicans face an uphill climb to keep control of Congress.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher and Nick Corasaniti

media:content.media:description: During his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Trump suggested that “it should be my third term” and falsely declared that the “only way” that Democrats “can get elected is to cheat.”

item.title: Trump’s Surgeon General Pick Sidesteps Questions on Vaccines
item.description: Also, the Cuban Government says it killed four people aboard a U.S. boat. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

media:content.media:credit: Alex Kent for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Dr. Casey Means in Washington, today.

item.title: TSA PreCheck Is Back, but Global Entry Is Paused. What’s Going On?
item.description: Blaming a partial government shutdown, officials suspended the expedited arrival program this week, but some travelers are seeing inconsistencies at airports.
item.dc:creator: Christine Chung and Ceylan Yeğinsu

media:content.media:description: The Global Entry program for low-risk travelers typically offers members kiosks they can use to speed through customs and immigration upon arrival in the United States.

item.title: Trump Officials Seek to Break Editorial ‘Firewall’ at U.S.-Funded News Agencies
item.description: Two federally funded newsrooms received a draft funding agreement that could give President Trump’s appointees the power to veto their new hires for editors in chief and chief executives.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim

media:content.media:description: Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty and Middle East Broadcasting Networks received a draft funding agreement that could give President Trump’s political appointees more control over their operations.

item.title: Antonio Tejero Molina, 93, Dies; Spanish Colonel Led Failed Coup
item.description: He held Spain’s Parliament hostage for 18 hours on Feb. 23, 1981, before surrendering after it became clear that he had little support from the country’s armed forces.
item.dc:creator: Alan Cowell
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
Juan Carlos I, King of Spain

media:content.media:description: Antonio Tejero Molina on Feb. 23, 1981, the day he led a takeover of the Parliament in Spain as part of an attempted coup.

item.title: Bird Flu Strikes California Elephant Seals for the First Time
item.description: Thirty seals, primarily weaned pups, have died since late last week, scientists said.
item.dc:creator: Emily Anthes and Apoorva Mandavilli
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media:content.media:description: Elephant seals at Año Nuevo State Park in Pescadero, Calif., last month.

item.title: Why South Korea’s Dubai Chewy Cookie Craze Rose and Fell So Fast
item.description: The brief life span of the Dubai chewy cookie reflects the country’s fast-moving food trends, where hype often matters more than taste.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:description: The dujjonku is a variation of Dubai chocolate, bars filled with pistachio cream and shredded phyllo known as kataifi, which became a global sensation in early 2025.

item.title: Ann Godoff, a Top Editor and Publisher of Best Sellers, Dies at 76
item.description: Considered an “author’s publisher” at Random House and then Penguin, she cultivated the careers of dozens of celebrated novelists and nonfiction writers.
item.dc:creator: Sam Roberts

media:content.media:description: Ann Godoff at the Random House offices in Manhattan in 1999 with the editor Robert Loomis. She had “a flawless sense of what would sell and what wouldn’t,” the biographer Ron Chernow said.

item.title: Trump Echoes Biden on the Economy in State of the Union Speech
item.description: President Trump’s arguments about the country during the State of the Union on Tuesday echoed those of President Biden’s two years ago.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Silva

item.title: Asesinato de Marielle Franco: el Supremo Tribunal de Brasil condena a 4 hombres
item.description: Dos políticos y dos expolicías fueron declarados culpables del asesinato de una rival, Marielle Franco, concejala de Río de Janeiro que luchaba contra la corrupción y la violencia.
item.dc:creator: Ana Ionova

media:content.media:credit: Renan Olaz/Rio De Janeiro Municipal Chamber
media:content.media:description: Marielle Franco, concejala en la Cámara Municipal de la ciudad de Río de Janeiro, dirigiendo una sesión en 2017 en la Cámara Municipal de Río de Janeiro.

item.description: The Gas Nord production facility of Harbour Energy Germany in Langwedel-Holtebüttel.
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Mann

media:content.media:description: The Gas Nord production facility of Harbour Energy Germany in Langwedel-Holtebüttel.

item.title: Nvidia’s Quarterly Profit Hits $43 Billion on Strong A.I. Chip Sales
item.description: Total profit for the fiscal year was $120 billion, the company said. Three years ago, it was just $4.4 billion.
item.dc:creator: Tripp Mickle

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Nvidia, led by Jensen Huang, above, said quarterly revenue from its chips for A.I. data centers had risen 71 percent to $61.7 billion.

item.title: Greek Politician Is Prosecuted for Admitting Drug Use Decades Ago
item.description: The leftist party of Yanis Varoufakis, a former finance minister and critic of the conservative government, said he had been charged based on admitting he had tried ecstasy once.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni and Niki Kitsantonis

media:content.media:credit: Angelos Tzortzinis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Yanis Varoufakis in 2015. He faces prosecution for admitting to using ecstasy 36 years ago.

item.title: ‘Tax the Rich’ Rally Draws 1,500 to Albany, but Not Mamdani or Hochul
item.description: Busloads of New Yorkers flooded the State Capitol to press state leaders to raise taxes on corporations and high earners to help fund various initiatives.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Oreskes
item.category: Our Time for an Affordable NYC (Nonprofit)

media:content.media:credit: Graham Dickie for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Rally participants marched from the Washington Avenue Armory to the State Capitol in Albany on Wednesday to deliver their message.

item.title: Inside Tapalpa, the Town in Mexico Where El Mencho Made His Last Stand
item.description: Times reporters visiting Tapalpa found a serene town in shock after Sunday’s raid on its outskirts left dozens dead and people fleeing. And, surprisingly, no police or military presence where the battle took place.
item.dc:creator: Paulina Villegas and César Rodríguez

media:content.media:credit: César Rodríguez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The town of Tapalpa, in Jalisco state, Mexico, is a stronghold of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

item.title: Maduro’s Lawyer Says U.S. is Blocking Venezuela From Paying Legal Fees
item.description: The Treasury Department is interfering with Nicolás Maduro’s constitutional right to counsel, his lawyer argued. Mr. Maduro, the Venezuelan leader, faces federal charges.
item.dc:creator: Jonah E. Bromwich
item.category: Office of Foreign Assets Control (United States Treasury)

media:content.media:credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Barry Pollack, carrying a folder, is representing the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, who is charged with federal crimes.

item.title: A Last Chance Before War
item.description: The U.S. and Iran both say they want to avoid a conflict. Time is running out to avoid one.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A march on the anniversary of the 1979 Islamic revolution in Tehran this month.

item.title: Man Accused of Plotting to Kill Trump Goes on Trial
item.description: Prosecutors said that Asif Merchant traveled to the United States in 2024, under the guise of a businessman, to coordinate plots to kill leaders, including President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Santul Nerkar

media:content.media:description: Asif Merchant is now on trial in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.
